caption: For all fashion lovers around the world, this exhibition is a must-see. This is what dreams are made of—it’s truly spectacular. The creations are absolutely divine, and you also have the chance to see a replica of Dior’s atelier and learn fascinating things about the history of the fashion house. It was quite crowded when I visited the gallery around noon on a Friday, but that didn’t take away from the charm of the place at all. Just one word to sum it all up—amazing!

It is much more incredible when you see it in person. I loved it so much. It is really big place with so many dresses and other clothing. You get to know the history. You see the place in this atelier exactly where the designer was working. Seriously one of the best museums I have seen in my life. Totally worth its money and you should definitely go there!

La Galerie Dior in Paris is an absolute must for fashion lovers! The museum is stunning, filled with themed rooms showcasing the incredible history of the Dior brand. The displays are elegant and immersive, and even the stairway in the lobby—lined with intricate miniature designs—is worth marveling at.  When I visited, the staff was friendly and welcoming, and everything was well-organized, with minimal waiting time. The exhibits are thoughtfully presented, with plenty of English explanations, making it super accessible for non-French speakers.  Whether you’re a fashion enthusiast or just curious about the artistry behind haute couture, this place is a must-visit. Don’t miss it when in Paris!

The dresses were beautiful and it was interesting to learn about the history of the brand. The line for the gallery viewing moved a bit too slowly and most things in the gift shop were overpriced. All in all, a pleasant visit. Would recommend.

A wonderful museum experience full of elegance! I visited the museum during a weekend when the entry was only 5 euros, and still getting into the museum required almost no waiting. The staff was very friendly and the museum itself very impressive, full of themed rooms and interesting history of fashion. If interested in fashion or its history, this place is a must-go! There are also plenty of history explanations written in English, so the museum is well-suited for non-French speaking visitors. And the stairway at the lobby alone is an interesting attraction, with surrounding walls full of detailed miniature designs.

A breathtaking experience at La Galerie Dior. Every inch of the space is pure elegance, showcasing the maison’s iconic legacy in the most stunning way. The collection is simply mesmerizing, and the ambiance is beyond words. To end this unforgettable visit, I indulged in the Dior signature star cake—a perfect, delicious finale. Can’t wait to return! ✨

After shopping we were able to access the La Galerie Dior. This is fashion heaven. The gowns were whimsical, each telling a story of elegance and artistry. As we wandered through the exhibits, we marveled at the intricate details and luxurious fabrics that adorned each piece. The atmosphere was filled with a sense of history, as if the very essence of couture lingered in the air. It was a dreamlike experience that left us inspired and in awe of the creativity that defines the world of high fashion. A must see if you want to visit Paris.

I visited here recently and it was my first time here which I can't believe as it truly is so beautiful and magical. Normally when i go to a museum or gallery I glance over what is wrote but here I read every word and took in all that was detailed. It was super interesting especially if you are interested in Dior. The dresses on display are just pure elegance and beauty. I could definitely see myself wearing a few especially the ones designed by John Galliano - so magnificent. I would advise people to buy tickets online but you can also queue with the hope of getting in. Staff here are all very nice, friendly and helpful. If you have coats or small shopping bags they do have small little lockers that you can put stuff in while you visit. Enjoy ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

stunning! beautiful fashion, excellent exhibition design, great bite-sized storytelling. the first room feels underwhelming but then everything from the forest room on...I think I said "wow" every time I entered a new room. highly recommend, totally worth the price.

I went to see many galleries in Paris so it was nice to see this one. I got there at 10.30am and the line for tickets was 1.5 hours wait. Do not go at that time! when I left around 1.30pm the line was less than 10 people. Go in the afternoon if you didn’t buy a ticket. The inside was quite nice and I like to read so the history was lovely to know.

Amazing place you enter with incredible miniatures following you up the winding staircase and come to the cafe that is expensive but very good. Then upstairs to 13 rooms of unbelievable original fashion and photos of Dior. Very cool and special.

Best to buy tickets beforehand as the website suggests. Also please be on time it helps to get inside in smaller groups so it doesn't get overcrowded. I had tickets and skipped the line. They have lockers for your belongings. The exhibition is worth it if you are interested in Dior or fashion in general. They also show how they bottle the handmade perfumes. They keep changing a few things (dresses) from time to time so don't hesitate to go back if you feel like it. I didn't have enough time to eat in their café, so can not say anything about that. Definitely recommend the museum.

Small museum in the Dior atelier, charting the history of Christian Dior, the man and the company. Some gorgeous and iconic outfits on display and rooms are beautifully and tastefully laid out. There is an (expensive, but location appropriate prices) cafe and small gift shop, but the flagship store is next door. Would recommend booking your ticket in advance. Staff very polite and helpful.

Beautiful museum with incredible pieces on display. I was also so impressed by all the miniatures that were created of the life-size dresses / bags. The entrance with the rainbow display of bags and clothes was also stunning. Would recommend!
Beautiful gallery. Well laid out and not too busy when we visited. We had reservations so didn't have to queue to get in. The highlight was the staircase.

Le Galerie Dior is an absolute masterpiece and a must-visit for any fashion enthusiast or admirer of haute couture. From the moment you step inside, you're immersed in the rich history and artistry of the Dior legacy. The exhibits are stunningly curated, showcasing iconic designs, sketches, and the evolution of Christian Dior's vision in an engaging and visually breathtaking way.  The attention to detail in the displays is remarkable, blending modern technology with timeless elegance. Highlights include the room of miniature dresses and the immersive timeline of Dior's contributions to fashion. The staff is knowledgeable and welcoming, adding to the overall experience.  Whether you're a longtime fan of Dior or simply appreciate beauty and craftsmanship, Le Galerie Dior is a treasure trove of inspiration and creativity. I can't recommend it enough – it’s an unforgettable experience in the heart of Paris!

The Dior Gallery is truly impressive, sparking imagination and showcasing the magic of fashion. It’s worth taking the time to explore this exceptional exhibition and stroll through the streets lined with the world’s most famous luxury brands. I recommend buying tickets in advance, as the queue times can vary significantly.

The Dior Gallery in Paris is a captivating tribute to the legendary fashion house, showcasing its rich history and iconic designs. Visitors can immerse themselves in exquisite exhibitions that highlight Dior's influence on the fashion world, complete with stunning garments and artistic displays. The gallery’s elegant setting enhances the experience, making it a must-visit for fashion enthusiasts and art lovers alike.

La Galerie Dior is an absolute pleasure.  Staff were discreet but well placed for any guest with questions.  The displays were very well done and informative with written captions in French and English.

It was ok.  The most beautiful aspect is the starcase with lots of bags and dresses displayed.   Other than that, there is not much else to see.   It's a very small museum.   The wait can be long especially if you haven't booked a ticket online before hand,  which needs to be done weeks in advance.  Overall,  it was ok.  If the wait is not too long,  worth a visit.  Otherwise, i think you can skip it and maybe just spend time at their store right next door - also has lots of beautiful displays and things that you can actually buy.

A beautiful gallery/ museum to learn about Dior and its haute couture journey from past to present. Our hotel reserved a skip the line ticket for us as we couldn’t get any online. We got there around 12pm on a Thursday and the line was very long despite the rain. Seems like a better time to visit might be in the afternoon as I understood that from the staff. The visit took about an hour and the Dior flag shop store is just conveniently next door for anyone interested to continue on the Dior experience. Worth a visit when in Paris.

Visited the world’s biggest Dior outlet. I must give my thanks to Chen Ping and Adrian who expertly helped me get all that we need, from bags to perfume. They even helped with the tax refunds. Amazing! I would be happy to visit and purchase from them again next time.  PS they even provide hotel delivery so you can continue shopping safely.

Definitely worth a visit whenever you're in Paris! Really intresting history of Christian Dior and you'll get to see so many amazing dresses, objects and artifacts from Dior. At the end there's a small café to have some drinks and lunch and theres also a small shop.

Beautiful place! Permanent exhibition and really worth the visit. I do highly recommend buying tickets in advance to avoid long wait in the non ticketed queue. If you get a ticket, do come in exact time for your slot or slightly earlier. Inside is a little cafe with cakes and few savoury options. There is also a little souvenir shop.

We spent a few hours at this beautiful gallery!  It is very informative with captions and displays in both French and English. A lot of Dior's designs are on display in creative and colorful ways. You begin the visit taking an elevator to the top floor and work your way down through the displays. We went on a Sunday morning and while there were many people in the first room, the crowds were more dispersed as we moved throughout the gallery.  Highlights include seeing Dior's office, work rooms and dresses designed for the Paris 2024 Opening Ceremony.

As a fashion enthusiast, blogger, and dedicated Dior fan, La Galerie Dior is a truly enchanting place that transports you into the world of fashion. The display wall is meticulously curated and color-coordinated, creating a visually stunning experience. The blend of classic and modern pieces is captivating, with new designs that left me in awe during my second visit. I was particularly thrilled to see the pieces showcased from the Olympics opening ceremony. I highly recommend a visit to this magical destination for any fashion lover.
It was very nice, u can see the history, and after that a lot of beautiful dresses and items and it’s definitely worth it to go!

The exhibition is amazing!!!! Highly recommended!!! We touched something really unique!! Only one thing to be changed, we had tickets that we bought online , we arrived in time , but still waited outside in the queue

#Beautiful art/fashion design gallerie on the life of Christian dior we spent 2 hours here a must see while in paris!💛 highly recommend purchasing tickets online in advance! #priority accommodations …

Dior Gallery is a great place even if you're a reluctant husband/boyfriend being dragged by your wife/ girlfriend  Besides fashion, the gallery showcases history, art and photography from Dior's legendary creative directors and photographers such as the late Peter Lindhberg.  A great place to visit if you are in Paris

This museum changes exhibits every 6 months.  Worth a stop through every visit to Paris.  For the Olympics they had the dresses from the opening ceremony on display.  Wonderfully curated.  Easy location from a metro stop.  Gift shop is small, not much in way of a museum gift shop.  I didn’t stop by the cafe, but heads up it is small with very little seating so if you are planning on making that a part of your time at the museum, plan ahead.  While reservations are not required, I recommend it.  If you have not reserved ahead you might not be able to gain entry if they are full.  Reservations through the website are easy.

This place is a temple of Haute couture and a splendid tribute to one of its greatest experts. The museum offers an extraordinary representation of fashion and its evolution in the second half of the last century and at the same time a grandiose celebration of one of the most prestigious French Maisons. The succession of rooms and the exhibition concept are cutting-edge and can not help but leave even the least interested visitor speechless. Absolutely recommended!
Fantastic museum,did not expect  it to be as much as it was.interesting to see how it all began .Would recommend,a nice experience to walk around,and see all the beautiful creations .
Wonderful experience at La Galerie Dior. Exceeded our expectations. Each room and theme was perfectly executed. Highly recommend.

Visiting this amazing destination was a highlight of my trip. Buying tickets on the spot turned out to be the best decision. Despite the crowd, navigating through and seeing everything was manageable. The atmosphere was both exciting and exquisite, making it a truly memorable experience. I absolutely loved it and can’t wait to return on my next visit to Paris.

This was a really amazing display of creativity even for someone who is not up with designers or trends. The sheer beauty and magnificence of everything on display especially the variegated colored mini display was totally worth it.

What a stunning exhibition! Having seen one at V&A in London this was amazing too. So interesting to see Christian Dior desk and many other things. When I go again I'll definately stop at their cafe. Well worth the trip.
This was the way fashion should be remembered, vivacious, provoking, a history of our times. A truly genius retrospective of all things Dior.
